member.returns: A TimeSpan equivalent of the string.
member.exception: Throws if the given string is not an edm:Duration expression

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Evaluation.IODataResourceMetadataContext
member.summary: Interface used for substitutability of the metadata-centric responsibilities of a resource. Metadata may come from a user-provided model or from the SetSerializationInfo() method on a resource set or resource. The latter is considered the "no-model" case since only strings are provided, and there is no interconnectedness. The goal of this interface is to provide a way to query the metadata information available on a resource without needing to know where the metadata originated from.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.IODataOutputInStreamErrorListener
member.summary: An interface that allows the implementations of the writers to get notified if an in-stream error is to be written.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.IODataOutputInStreamErrorListener.OnInStreamError
member.summary: This method notifies the listener, that an in-stream error is to be written.
member.remarks: This listener can choose to fail, if the currently written payload doesn't support in-stream error at this position. If the listener returns, the writer should not allow any more writing, since the in-stream error is the last thing in the payload.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.IODataPayloadUriConverter
member.summary: Supports custom conversion of URLs found in the payload.
member.remarks: This interface can be implemented on messages (see and ). When a message implementing this interface is passed to an or , the message writer/reader will use this interface for custom URL conversion. On writers this means that whenever a URI is written into the payload the conversion method on this interface is called to convert a base URI and a payload URI to the actual URI to be written to the payload. If the method returns null from a conversion call the default conversion will be used. On readers this means that a base URI (either from the payload or the reader settings) and the URI read from the payload are passed to the method. The result is what is being reported on the OData OM instances. Again if the conversion method returns null the default conversion kicks in.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.IODataPayloadUriConverter.ConvertPayloadUri(System.Uri,System.Uri)
member.summary: Implements a custom URL conversion scheme. This method returns null if no custom conversion is desired. If the method returns a non-null URL that value will be used without further validation.
member.returns: An instance that reflects the custom conversion of the method arguments into a URL or null if no custom conversion is desired; in that case the default conversion is used.
member.param: The (optional) base URI to use for the conversion.
The URI read from the payload.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.IODataResourceTypeContext
member.summary: Interface used for substitutability, to answer basic questions regarding the type of the resource or resource set. Metadata may come from a user-provided model or from the SetSerializationInfo() method on a resource set or resource. The latter is considered the "no-model" case since only strings are provided, and there is no interconnectedness. The goal of this interface is to provide a way to query the metadata information available on a resource or resource set without needing to know where the metadata originated from.

member.summary: The kind of the navigation source of the resource set or resource.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.IODataResourceTypeContext.ExpectedResourceTypeName
member.summary: The expected entity type name of the resource. For example, in the request URI 'http://example.com/Service.svc/People/Namespace.VIP_Person', the expected entity type is Namespace.VIP_Person. (The entity set element type name in this example may be Person, and the actual entity type of a particular entity might be a type more derived than VIP_Person)

member.summary: Resolves and validates the payload type against the expected type and returns the target type.
member.param: The expected type kind for the value.
This value indicates if a structured type is expected to be return. True for structured type, false for non-structured type, null for indetermination.
The default payload type if none is specified in the payload; for ATOM this is Edm.String, for JSON it is null since there is no payload type name for primitive types in the payload.
The expected type reference, or null if no expected type is available.
The payload type name, or null if no payload type was specified.
The model to use.
A func to compute the type kind from the payload shape if it could not be determined from the expected type or the payload type.
The target type kind to be used to read the payload.
Potentially non-null instance of an annotation to put on the value reported from the reader.
member.returns: The target type reference to use for parsing the value. If there is no user specified model, this will return null. If there is a user specified model, this method never returns null.
member.remarks: This method cannot be used for primitive type resolution. Primitive type resolution is format dependent and format specific methods should be used instead.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.JsonFullMetadataLevel
member.summary: Class responsible for logic specific to the JSON Light full metadata level (indicated by "odata.metadata=full" in the media type).
member.remarks: The general rule-of-thumb for full-metadata payloads is that they include all "odata.*" annotations that would be included in minimal metadata mode, plus any "odata.*" annotations that could be computed client-side if we the client had a model.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.JsonMinimalMetadataLevel
member.summary: Class responsible for logic specific to the JSON Light minimal metadata level (indicated by "odata.metadata=minimal" in the media type, or lack of an "odata" parameter in a v3 and above request).
member.remarks: The general rule-of-thumb for minimal-metadata payloads is that they include all "odata.*" annotations that can't be computed client-side, assuming the client has the server model available as well as the ability to compute missing payload metadata based on the standard conventions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.JsonNoMetadataLevel
member.summary: Class responsible for logic specific to the JSON Light no metadata level (indicated by "odata.metadata=none" in the media type).
member.remarks: The general rule-of-thumb for no-metadata payloads is that they omit any "odata.*" annotations, except for odata.nextlink and odata.count, since the client would get a inaccurate representation of the data available if they were left out.

member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightCollectionDeserializer.ReadCollectionStart(Microsoft.OData.PropertyAndAnnotationCollector,System.Boolean,Microsoft.OData.Edm.IEdmTypeReference,Microsoft.OData.Edm.IEdmTypeReference@)
member.summary: Reads the start of a collection; this includes collection-level properties (e.g., the 'results' property) if the version permits it.
member.param: The duplicate property names checker used to keep track of the properties and annotations in the collection wrapper object.
true if we are reading a nested collection inside a paramter payload; otherwise false.
The expected item type reference or null if none is expected.
The validated actual item type reference (if specified in the payload) or the expected item type reference.
member.returns: An representing the collection-level information. Currently this is only the name of the collection in ATOM.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: Any: the start of a nested collection value; if this is not a 'StartArray' node this method will fail. JsonNodeType.Property: the first property of the collection wrapper object after the context URI. JsonNodeType.EndObject: when the collection wrapper object has no properties (other than the context URI). Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.StartArray: the start of the array of the collection items.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightCollectionDeserializer.ReadCollectionItem(Microsoft.OData.Edm.IEdmTypeReference,Microsoft.OData.CollectionWithoutExpectedTypeValidator)
member.summary: Reads an item in the collection.
member.param: The expected type of the item to read.
The collection validator instance if no expected item type has been specified; otherwise null.
member.returns: The value of the collection item that was read; this can be a primitive value or 'null'.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: The first node of the item in the collection NOTE: this method will throw if the node is not JsonNodeType.PrimitiveValue: for a primitive item Post-Condition: The reader is positioned on the first node of the next item or an EndArray node if there are no more items in the collection

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightCollectionDeserializer.ReadCollectionEnd(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads the end of a collection; this includes collection-level instance annotations.
member.param: true if we are reading a nested collection inside a paramter payload; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: EndArray node: End of the collection content array Post-Condition: EndOfInput: All of the collection payload has been consumed.

member.returns: If the property is a valid OData annotation of a collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightCollectionReader.ReadAtCollectionStartImplementation
member.summary: Implementation of the reader logic when in state 'CollectionStart'.
member.returns: true if more nodes can be read from the reader; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: The first node of the first item in the collection or the EndArray node of the (empty) item array NOTE: this method will throw if the node is not JsonNodeType.EndArray: for an empty item array of the collection JsonNodeType.StartObject: for a complex value as first item JsonNodeType.PrimitiveValue: for a primitive value as first item Post-Condition: The reader is positioned on the first node of the second item or an EndArray node if there are no items in the collection

member.remarks: Pre-Condition: The first node of the first item in the collection or the EndArray node of the (empty) item array NOTE: this method will throw if the node is not JsonNodeType.EndArray: for an empty item array of the collection JsonNodeType.StartObject: for a complex value as first item JsonNodeType.PrimitiveValue: for a primitive value as first item Post-Condition: The reader is positioned on the first node of the second item or an EndArray node if there are no items in the collection

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightCollectionReader.ReadAtValueImplementation
member.summary: Implementation of the reader logic when in state 'Value'.
member.returns: true if more nodes can be read from the reader; otherwise false.

member.summary: Implementation of the reader logic when in state 'Value'.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightCollectionReader.ReadAtCollectionEndImplementation

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightDeltaReader.ReadAtStartImplementationSynchronously(Microsoft.OData.PropertyAndAnnotationCollector)
member.summary: Implementation of the reader logic when in state 'Start'.
member.param: The duplicate property names checker to use for the top-level scope.
member.returns: true if more items can be read from the reader; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property: the reader is positioned on the context uri annotation. Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.EndArray: the reader is positioned on the end array node of an empty resource set. JsonNodeType.StartObject: the reader is positioned on the first item.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightDeltaReader.ReadAtDeltaResourceSetStartImplementationSynchronously
member.summary: Implementation of the reader logic when in state 'DeltaResourceSetStart'.
member.returns: true if more items can be read from the reader; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: Any start node - The first resource in the resource set JsonNodeType.EndArray - The end of the resource set Post-Condition: The reader is positioned over the StartObject node of the first resource in the resource set or on the node following the resource set end in case of an empty resource set

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightDeltaReader.ReadAtDeltaResourceSetEndImplementationSynchronously

member.summary: Implementation of the reader logic when in state 'DeltaResourceStart'.
member.returns: true if more items can be read from the reader; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property The next annotation. JsonNodeType.EndObject No more other annotation or property in the resource. Post-Condition: The reader is positioned on the first node after the resource's end-object node.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightDeltaReader.ReadDeltaStart(Microsoft.OData.PropertyAndAnnotationCollector,Microsoft.OData.SelectedPropertiesNode)
member.summary: Reads the start of a delta item and sets up the reader state correctly
member.param: The duplicate property names checker to use for the resource; or null if a new one should be created.
The selected properties node capturing what properties should be expanded during template evaluation.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.StartObject If the resource is in a resource set - the start of the resource object JsonNodeType.Property If the resource is a top-level resource and has at least one property JsonNodeType.EndObject If the resource is a top-level resource and has no properties Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.StartObject Start of expanded resource of the nested resource info to read next JsonNodeType.Property Property after deferred link or expanded entity reference JsonNodeType.EndObject If no (more) properties exist in the resource's content

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightDeltaReader.ReadDeltaResourceId
member.summary: Reads the delta resource id annotation (odata.id)
member.remarks:
Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property The first property after the odata.context in the resource object. JsonNodeType.EndObject End of the resource object. Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property The property after the odata.type (if there was any), or the property on which the method was called. JsonNodeType.EndObject End of the resource object.
This method fills the ODataResource.Id property if the id is found in the payload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightDeltaWriter.Microsoft#OData#IODataOutputInStreamErrorListener#OnInStreamError
member.summary: This method notifies the listener, that an in-stream error is to be written.
member.remarks: This listener can choose to fail, if the currently written payload doesn't support in-stream error at this position. If the listener returns, the writer should not allow any more writing, since the in-stream error is the last thing in the payload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightDeserializer.ReadPayloadStart(Microsoft.OData.ODataPayloadKind,Microsoft.OData.PropertyAndAnnotationCollector,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Read the start of the top-level data wrapper in JSON responses.
member.param: The kind of payload we are reading; this guides the parsing of the context URI.
The duplicate property names checker.
true if we are deserializing a nested payload, e.g. a resource, a resource set or a collection within a parameters payload.
true if we allow a completely empty payload; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.None: assumes that the JSON reader has not been used yet when not reading a nested payload. Post-Condition: The reader is positioned on the first property of the payload after having read (or skipped) the context URI property. Or the reader is positioned on an end-object node if there are no properties (other than the context URI which is required in responses and optional in requests).

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightDeserializer.ReadPayloadStartAsync(Microsoft.OData.ODataPayloadKind,Microsoft.OData.PropertyAndAnnotationCollector,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

The duplicate property names checker.
true if we are deserializing a nested payload, e.g. a resource, a resource set or a collection within a parameters payload.
true if we allow a completely empty payload; otherwise false.
member.returns: The parsed context URI.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.None: assumes that the JSON reader has not been used yet when not reading a nested payload. Post-Condition: The reader is positioned on the first property of the payload after having read (or skipped) the context URI property. Or the reader is positioned on an end-object node if there are no properties (other than the context URI which is required in responses and optional in requests).

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightDeserializer.ReadPayloadEnd(System.Boolean)

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightDeserializer.SkippedOverUnknownODataAnnotation(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: If is under the odata namespace but is not known to ODataLib, move the JSON reader forward to skip the annotation name and value then return true; return false otherwise.
member.remarks: The unknown odata annotation is skipped so that when this version of the reader reads a resource set produced by a future version of ODataLib that contains an odata annotation that is not recognized on this version, we would simply ignore the annotation rather than failing. Note that when we add new odata annotations that cannot be skipped, we would bump the protocol version.
member.param: The annotation name in question.
Outputs the .
member.returns: Returns true if the annotation name and value is skipped; returns false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightDeserializer.ParseProperty(Microsoft.OData.PropertyAndAnnotationCollector,System.Func{System.String,System.Object},System.String@)
member.summary: Parses JSON object property starting with the current position of the JSON reader.
member.param: The duplicate property names checker to use, it will also store the property annotations found.
Function called to read property annotation value.
The name of the property or instance annotation found.
member.returns: PropertyWithValue - a property with value was found. The contains the name of the property. The reader is positioned on the property value. PropertyWithoutValue - a property without a value was found. The contains the name of the property. The reader is positioned on the node after property annotations (so either a property or end of object). ODataInstanceAnnotation - an odata instance annotation was found. The contains the name of the annotation. The reader is positioned on the value of the annotation. CustomInstanceAnnotation - a custom instance annotation was found. The contains the name of the annotation. The reader is positioned on the value of the annotation. MetadataReferenceProperty - a property which is a reference into the metadata was found. The reader is positioned on the value of the property. EndOfObject - end of the object scope was reached and no properties are to be reported. The is null. This can only happen if there's a property annotation which is ignored (for example custom one) at the end of the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightDeserializer.ReadPayloadStartImplementation(Microsoft.OData.ODataPayloadKind,Microsoft.OData.PropertyAndAnnotationCollector,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Read the start of the top-level data wrapper in JSON responses.
member.param: The kind of payload we are reading; this guides the parsing of the context URI.
The duplicate property names checker.
true if we are deserializing a nested payload, e.g. a resource, a resource set or a collection within a parameters payload.
true if we allow a completely empty payload; otherwise false.
member.returns: The value of the context URI annotation (or null if it was not found).
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.None: assumes that the JSON reader has not been used yet when not reading a nested payload. Post-Condition: The reader is positioned on the first property of the payload after having read (or skipped) the context URI property. Or the reader is positioned on an end-object node if there are no properties (other than the context URI which is required in responses and optional in requests).

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightErrorDeserializer.ReadJsonObjectInErrorPayload(System.Action{System.String,Microsoft.OData.PropertyAndAnnotationCollector})
member.summary: Reads all the properties in a single JSON object scope, calling for each non-annotation property encountered.
member.param: An action which takes the name of the current property and processes the property value as necessary. At the start of this action, the reader is positioned at the property value node. The action should leave the reader positioned on the node after the property value.
member.remarks:
This method should only be used for scopes where we allow (and ignore) annotations in a custom namespace, i.e. scopes which directly correspond to a class in the OM.
Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.StartObject - The start of the JSON object being processed. any - Will throw if not StartObject. Post-Condition: any - The node after the EndObject node for the JSON object being processed.

member.summary: Reads a value of property annotation on an error payload.
member.param: The name of the property annotation to read.
member.returns: The value of the property annotation.
member.remarks:
This method should read the property annotation value and return a representation of the value which will be later consumed by the resource reading code, or throw if ther is something unexpected.
Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.PrimitiveValue The value of the property annotation property JsonNodeType.StartObject JsonNodeType.StartArray Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.EndObject The end of the error object JsonNodeType.Property The next property after the property annotation

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightOutputContext.WriteInStreamError(Microsoft.OData.ODataError,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes an into the message payload.
member.param: The error to write.
A flag indicating whether debug information (e.g., the inner error from the ) should be included in the payload. This should only be used in debug scenarios.
member.remarks: This method is called if the ODataMessageWriter.WriteError is called once some other write operation has already started. The method should write the in-stream error representation for the specific format into the current payload. Before the method is called no flush is performed on the output context or any active writer. It is the responsibility of this method to flush the output before the method returns.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightOutputContext.WriteInStreamErrorAsync(Microsoft.OData.ODataError,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes an into the message payload.
member.param: The error to write.
A flag indicating whether debug information (e.g., the inner error from the ) should be included in the payload. This should only be used in debug scenarios.
member.returns: Task which represents the pending write operation.
member.remarks: This method is called if the ODataMessageWriter.WriteError is called once some other write operation has already started. The method should write the in-stream error representation for the specific format into the current payload. Before the method is called no flush is performed on the output context or any active writer. It is the responsibility of this method to make sure that all the data up to this point are written before the in-stream error is written. It is the responsibility of this method to flush the output before the task finishes.

member.summary: Reads the next parameter from the parameters payload.

member.remarks: Pre-Condition: Property or EndObject the property node of the parameter to read or the end object node if there are not parameters Post-Condition: Property or EndObject the node after the property value of a primitive, complex or null collection parameter Any the start of the value representing a non-null collection parameter (the collection reader will fail if this is not a StartArray node)

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightParameterReader.ReadAtStartImplementation
member.summary: Implementation of the reader logic when in state 'Start'.
member.returns: true if more items can be read from the reader; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.None: assumes that the JSON reader has not been used yet. Post-Condition: When the new state is Value, the reader is positioned at the closing '}' or at the name of the next parameter. When the new state is Resource, the reader is positioned at the starting '{' of the resource payload. When the new state is Resource Set or Collection, the reader is positioned at the starting '[' of the resource set or collection payload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightParameterReader.ReadAtStartImplementationAsync
member.summary: Implementation of the parameter reader logic when in state 'Start'.
member.returns: true if more items can be read from the reader; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.None: assumes that the JSON reader has not been used yet. Post-Condition: When the new state is Value, the reader is positioned at the closing '}' or at the name of the next parameter. When the new state is Resource, the reader is positioned at the starting '{' of the resource payload. When the new state is Resource Set or Collection, the reader is positioned at the starting '[' of the resource set or collection payload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightParameterReader.ReadNextParameterImplementation
member.summary: Implementation of the reader logic on the subsequent reads after the first parameter is read.
member.returns: true if more items can be read from the reader; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property or JsonNodeType.EndObject: assumes the last read puts the reader at the begining of the next parameter or at the end of the payload. Post-Condition: When the new state is Value, the reader is positioned at the closing '}' or at the name of the next parameter. When the new state is Resource, the reader is positioned at the starting '{' of the resource payload. When the new state is Resource Set or Collection, the reader is positioned at the starting '[' of the resource set or collection payload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightParameterReader.ReadNextParameterImplementationAsync
member.summary: Implementation of the reader logic when in state Value, Resource, Resource Set or Collection state.
member.returns: true if more items can be read from the reader; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property or JsonNodeType.EndObject: assumes the last read puts the reader at the begining of the next parameter or at the end of the payload. Post-Condition: When the new state is Value, the reader is positioned at the closing '}' or at the name of the next parameter. When the new state is Resource, the reader is positioned at the starting '{' of the resource payload. When the new state is Resource Set or Collection, the reader is positioned at the starting '[' of the resource set or collection payload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightParameterReader.ReadNextParameterImplementationSynchronously
member.summary: Implementation of the reader logic on the subsequent reads after the first parameter is read.
member.returns: true if more items can be read from the reader; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property or JsonNodeType.EndObject: assumes the last read puts the reader at the begining of the next parameter or at the end of the payload. Post-Condition: When the new state is Value, the reader is positioned at the closing '}' or at the name of the next parameter. When the new state is Resource, the reader is positioned at the starting '{' of the resource payload. When the new state is Resource Set or Collection, the reader is positioned at the starting '[' of the resource set or collection payload.

member.summary: Creates an to read the resource set value of type .

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightParameterReader.CreateCollectionReaderSynchronously(Microsoft.OData.Edm.IEdmTypeReference)
member.summary: Creates an to read the collection with type .
member.param: Expected item type reference of the collection to read.
member.returns: An to read the collection with type .
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: Any: the reader should be on the start array node of the collection value; if it is not we let the collection reader fail. Post-Condition: Any: the reader should be on the start array node of the collection value; if it is not we let the collection reader fail. NOTE: this method does not move the reader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightPropertyAndValueDeserializer.TryReadODataTypeAnnotationValue(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to read an annotation as OData type name annotation.
member.param: The annotation name on which value the reader is positioned on.
The read value of the annotation (string).
member.returns: true if the annotation is an OData type name annotation, false otherwise.
member.remarks:
Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.PrimitiveValue - the value of the annotation JsonNodeType.StartObject JsonNodeType.StartArray Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property - the next property after the annotation JsonNodeType.EndObject - end of the parent object JsonNodeType.PrimitiveValue - the reader didn't move JsonNodeType.StartObject JsonNodeType.StartArray
If the method returns true, it consumed the value of the annotation from the reader. If it returns false, it didn't move the reader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightReader.ReadAtResourceSetEndImplementation
member.summary: Implementation of the reader logic when in state 'ResourceSetEnd'.

member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property if the resource set has further instance or property annotations after the resource set property JsonNodeType.EndObject if the resource set has no further instance or property annotations after the resource set property Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.EndOfInput for a top-level resource set when not reading a nested payload JsonNodeType.Property more properties exist on the owning resource after the expanded link containing the resource set JsonNodeType.EndObject no further properties exist on the owning resource after the expanded link containing the resource set JsonNodeType.EndArray end of expanded link in request, in this case the resource set doesn't actually own the array object and it won't read it. Any in case of expanded resource set in request, this might be the next item in the expanded array, which is not a resource

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightResourceDeserializer
member.summary: OData JsonLight deserializer for entries and resource sets.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightResourceDeserializer.#ctor(Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightInputContext)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The JsonLight input context to read from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightResourceDeserializer.ReadResourceSetContentStart
member.summary: Reads the start of the JSON array for the content of the resource set.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.StartArray: The start of the resource set property array; this method will fail if the node is anything else. Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.StartObject: The first item in the resource set JsonNodeType.PrimitiveValue: A null resource, or a primitive value within an untyped collection JsonNodeType.StartArray: A nested collection within an untyped collection JsonNodeType.EndArray: The end of the resource set

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightResourceDeserializer.ReadResourceSetContentEnd
member.summary: Reads the end of the array containing the resource set content.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.EndArray Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property if the resource set is part of an expanded nested resource info and there are more properties in the object JsonNodeType.EndObject if the resource set is a top-level resource set or the expanded nested resource info is the last property of the payload JsonNodeType.EndOfInput if the resource set is in a Uri operation parameter JsonNodeType.StartArray if the resource set is a member of an untyped collection followed by a collection JsonNodeType.PrimitiveValue if the resource set is a member of an untyped collection followed by a primitive value JsonNodeType.StartObject if the resource set is a member of an untyped collection followed by a resource JsonNodeType.EndArray if the resource set is the last member of an untyped collection

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightResourceDeserializer.ReadResourceTypeName(Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.IODataJsonLightReaderResourceState)
member.summary: Reads the resource type name annotation (odata.type)
member.param: The state of the reader for resource to read.
member.remarks:
Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property The first property after the odata.context in the resource object. JsonNodeType.EndObject End of the resource object. Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property The property after the odata.type (if there was any), or the property on which the method was called. JsonNodeType.EndObject End of the resource object.
This method fills the ODataResource.TypeName property if the type name is found in the payload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightResourceDeserializer.ReadResourceContent(Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.IODataJsonLightReaderResourceState)

member.param: The state of the reader for resource to read.
member.returns: A reader nested resource info representing the nested resource info detected while reading the resource contents; null if no nested resource info was detected.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property The property to read JsonNodeType.EndObject If no (more) properties exist in the resource's content Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.EndObject If no (more) properties exist in the resource's content JsonNodeType.Property If we've read a deferred link (this is the property after the deferred link) JsonNodeType.StartObject Expanded resource JsonNodeType.StartArray Expanded resource set JsonNodeType.PrimitiveValue (null) Expanded null

member.remarks: Pre-Condition: The reader is positioned on the first node of the property value Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property: the next property of the resource JsonNodeType.EndObject: the end-object node of the resource

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightResourceDeserializer.InnerReadUndeclaredProperty(Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.IODataJsonLightReaderResourceState,Microsoft.OData.Edm.IEdmStructuredType,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Read an open property.
member.param: The state of the reader for resource to read.
The owning type of the property with name or null if no metadata is available.
The name of the open property to read.
true if the property has a value, false if it doesn't.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: The reader is positioned on the first node of the property value Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property: the next property of the resource JsonNodeType.EndObject: the end-object node of the resource
member.returns: The NestedResourceInfo or null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightResourceDeserializer.ReadUndeclaredProperty(Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.IODataJsonLightReaderResourceState,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Read an undeclared property. That is a property which is not declared by the model, but the owning type is not an open type.
member.param: The state of the reader for resource to read.
The name of the open property to read.
true if the property has a value, false if it doesn't.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.PrimitiveValue: propertyWithValue is true and the reader is positioned on the first node of the property value. JsonNodeType.StartObject: JsonNodeType.StartArray: JsonNodeType.Property: propertyWithValue is false and the reader is positioned on the node after the property. JsonNodeType.EndObject: Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property: the next property of the resource JsonNodeType.EndObject: the end-object node of the resource
member.returns: A nested resource info instance if the property read is a nested resource info which should be reported to the caller. Otherwise null if the property was either ignored or read and added to the list of properties on the resource.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightResourceDeserializer.ReadStreamPropertyValue(Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.IODataJsonLightReaderResourceState,System.String)
member.summary: Reads a stream property value from the property annotations.
member.param: The state of the reader for resource to read.
The name of the stream property to read the value for.
member.returns: The newly created stream reference value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ODataJsonLightResourceDeserializer.ReadSingleOperationValue(Microsoft.OData.Json.IODataJsonOperationsDeserializerContext,Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.IODataJsonLightReaderResourceState,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads one operation for the resource being read.
member.param: The Json operation deserializer context.
The state of the reader for resource to read.
The name of the metadata reference property being read.
true if the operation value is inside an array, i.e. multiple targets for the operation; false otherwise.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.StartObject: first node of the operation value. Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.Property: the property after the current operation being read when there is one target for the operation. JsonNodeType.StartObject: the first node of the next operation value when there are multiple targets for the operation. JsonNodeType.EndArray: the end-array of the operation values when there are multiple target for the operation.

member.summary: Constructor.

The maximum number of recursive internalexception objects to allow when reading in-stream errors.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.ProcessObjectValue
member.summary: Called whenever we find a new object value in the payload. Buffers and re-orders an object value for later consumption by the JsonLight reader.
member.remarks: This method is called when the reader is in the buffering mode and can read ahead (buffering) as much as it needs to once it returns the reader will be returned to the position before the method was called. The reader is always positioned on a start object when this method is called.

member.summary: Reads a property name from the JSON reader and determines if it's a regular property, an instance annotation or a property annotation.
member.param: The name of the regular property which the reader is positioned on or which a property annotation belongs to.
The name of the instance or property annotation, or null if the reader is on a regular property.

member.summary: Reads over a value buffering it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedObject.propertyCache
member.summary: The cache for properties.
member.remarks: The key is the property or instance annotation name, the value are the buffered properties grouped by property name (incl. annotation properties).

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedObject.dataProperties
member.summary: The set of data property names.

member.summary: A list of property names with their annotation name.
member.remarks: This is needed to properly maintain the relative order of annotation properties if no data property for the annotation property exists in the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedObject.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.summary: The node in the linked list of buffered nodes where this object starts.

member.summary: The current buffered property being processed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedObject.AddBufferedProperty(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedProperty)
member.summary: Adds a new buffered property to the list of buffered properties for this object.
member.param: The name of the data property (null for instance annotations).
The name of the annotation (null for data properties).
The buffered property to add.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedObject.Reorder
member.summary: Reorders the buffered properties to conform to the required payload order.
member.remarks: The required order is: odata.context comes first, odata.type comes next, then all odata.* property annotations and finally, we preserve the relative order of custom annotations and data properties.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedObject.SortBufferedProperties(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedProperty})
member.summary: Sort the data properties and property annotations stored for a particular property name.
member.param: The list of buffered properties to sort.
member.returns: The sorted enumerable of buffered properties.
member.remarks: The sort order is for all odata.* property annotations to come before the data property but otherwise preserve the relative order of custom property annotations with regard to the position of the data property.

member.summary: Checks whether an annotation name is an odata.* annotation.
member.param: The annotation name to check.
member.returns: true if the annotation name represents an odata.* annotation; otherwise false.

member.summary: Checks whether an annotation name is a odata.context annotation.
member.param: The annotation name to check.
member.returns: true if the annotation name represents an odata.context annotation; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedObject.IsODataTypeAnnotation(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether an annotation name is a odata.type annotation.
member.param: The annotation name to check.
member.returns: true if the annotation name represents an odata.type annotation; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedObject.IsODataIdAnnotation(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether an annotation name is a odata.id annotation.
member.param: The annotation name to check.
member.returns: true if the annotation name represents an odata.id annotation; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedObject.IsODataETagAnnotation(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether an annotation name is a odata.etag annotation.
member.param: The annotation name to check.
member.returns: true if the annotation name represents an odata.etag annotation; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedObject.SortPropertyNames
member.summary: Sorts the property names for an object.
member.returns: The sorted enumerable of property names.
member.remarks: The sort order is to put odata.context first, then odata.type, odata.id, and odata.etag, followed by all other odata.* instance annotations. For the rest, we preserve the relative order of custom annotations with regard to the data property. Note that we choose the position of the first property annotation in cases where no data property for a set of property annotations exists.

member.summary: Moves the reader to the bookmarked position.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.BufferingJsonReader.StopBuffering
member.summary: Puts the reader into the state where no buffering happen on read. Either buffered nodes are consumed or new nodes are read (and not buffered).

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.BufferingJsonReader.StartBufferingAndTryToReadInStreamErrorPropertyValue(Microsoft.OData.ODataError@)
member.summary: A method to detect whether the current property value represents an in-stream error.
member.param: The read from the payload.
member.returns: true if the current value is an in-stream error value; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.BufferingJsonReader.ReadInternal
member.summary: Reads the next node from the input. If we have still nodes in the buffer, takes the node from there. Otherwise reads a new node from the underlying reader and buffers it (depending on the current mode).
member.returns: true if a new node was found, or false if end of input was reached.
member.remarks: If the parsingInStreamError field is false, the method will read ahead for every StartObject node read from the input to check whether the JSON object represents an in-stream error. If so, it throws an . If false, this check will not happen. This parsingInStremError field is set to true when trying to parse an in-stream error; in normal operation it is false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.BufferingJsonReader.ProcessObjectValue
member.summary: Called whenever we find a new object value in the payload. The base class implementation reads ahead and tries to parse it as an in-stream error payload. If it finds one it will throw it.
member.remarks: This method is called when the reader is in the buffering mode and can read ahead (buffering) as much as it needs to once it returns the reader will be returned to the position before the method was called. The reader is always positioned on a start object when this method is called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.BufferingJsonReader.ReadNextAndCheckForInStreamError
member.summary: Reads the next node from the JSON reader and if a start-object node is detected starts reading ahead and tries to parse an in-stream error.
member.returns: true if a new node was found, or false if end of input was reached.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.BufferingJsonReader.TryReadInStreamErrorPropertyValue(Microsoft.OData.ODataError@)
member.summary: Try to read an error structure from the stream. Return null if no error structure can be read.
member.param: An instance that was read from the reader or null if none could be read.
member.returns: true if an instance that was read; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.BufferingJsonReader.TryReadInnerErrorPropertyValue(Microsoft.OData.ODataInnerError@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Try to read an inner error property value.

The number of times this method has been called recursively.
member.returns: true if an instance that was read; otherwise false.

member.summary: Reads the string value of a property.

member.returns: true if a string value (or null) was read as property value of the current property; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.BufferingJsonReader.SkipValueInternal
member.summary: Skips over a JSON value (primitive, object or array) while parsing in-stream errors. Note that the SkipValue extension method can not be used in this case as this method has to access the base instance's NodeType and call ReadInternal.
member.remarks: Pre-Condition: JsonNodeType.PrimitiveValue, JsonNodeType.StartArray or JsonNodeType.StartObject Post-Condition: JsonNodeType.PrimitiveValue, JsonNodeType.EndArray or JsonNodeType.EndObject

member.summary: Interface for a class that can read arbitrary JSON.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Json.IJsonReader.Value
member.summary: The value of the last reported node.
member.remarks: This is non-null only if the last node was a PrimitiveValue or Property. If the last node is a PrimitiveValue this property returns the value: - null if the null token was found. - boolean if the true or false token was found. - string if a string token was found. - DateTime if a string token formatted as DateTime was found. - Int32 if a number which fits into the Int32 was found. - Double if a number which doesn't fit into Int32 was found. If the last node is a Property this property returns a string which is the name of the property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader
member.summary: Reader for the JSON format. http://www.json.org

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.InitialCharacterBufferSize
member.summary: The initial size of the buffer of characters.
member.remarks: 4K (page size) divided by the size of a single character 2 and a little less so that array structures also fit into that page. The goal is for the entire buffer to fit into one page so that we don't cause too many L1 cache misses.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.MaxCharacterCountToMove
member.summary: Maximum number of characters to move in the buffer. If the current token size is bigger than this, we will allocate a larger buffer.
member.remarks: This threshold is copied from the XmlReader implementation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.reader
member.summary: The text reader to read input characters from.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.isIeee754Compatible
member.summary: If it is IEEE754Compatible, read quoted string for INT64 and decimal; otherwise read number directly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.scopes
member.summary: Stack of scopes.
member.remarks: At the beginning the Root scope is pushed to the stack and stays there for the entire parsing (so that we don't have to check for empty stack and also to track the number of root-level values) Each time a new object or array is started the Object or Array scope is pushed to the stack. If a property inside an Object is found, the Property scope is pushed to the stack. The Property is popped once we find the value for the property. The Object and Array scopes are popped when their end is found.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.allowAnnotations
member.summary: true if annotations are allowed and thus the reader has to accept more characters in property names than we do normally; otherwise false.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.endOfInputReached
member.summary: End of input from the reader was already reached.
member.remarks: This is used to avoid calling Read on the text reader multiple times even though it already reported the end of input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.characterBuffer
member.summary: Buffer of characters from the input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.storedCharacterCount
member.summary: Number of characters available in the input buffer.
member.remarks: This can have value of 0 to characterBuffer.Length.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.tokenStartIndex
member.summary: Index into the characterBuffer which points to the first character of the token being currently processed (while in the Read method) or of the next token to be processed (while in the caller code).
member.remarks: This can have value from 0 to storedCharacterCount.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.nodeType
member.summary: The last reported node type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.nodeValue
member.summary: The value of the last reported node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.stringValueBuilder
member.summary: Cached string builder to be used when constructing string values (needed to resolve escape sequences).
member.remarks: The string builder instance is cached to avoid excessive allocation when many string values with escape sequences are found in the payload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.#ctor(System.IO.TextReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The text reader to read input characters from.
If it is isIeee754Compatible

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ScopeType
member.summary: Various scope types for Json writer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ScopeType.Root
member.summary: Root scope - the top-level of the JSON content.
member.remarks: This scope is only once on the stack and that is at the bottom, always. It's used to track the fact that only one top-level value is allowed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ScopeType.Array
member.summary: Array scope - inside an array.
member.remarks: This scope is pushed when [ is found and is active before the first and between the elements in the array. Between the elements it's active when the parser is in front of the comma, the parser is never after comma as then it always immediately processed the next token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ScopeType.Object
member.summary: Object scope - inside the object (but not in a property value).
member.remarks: This scope is pushed when { is found and is active before the first and between the properties in the object. Between the properties it's active when the parser is in front of the comma, the parser is never after comma as then it always immediately processed the next token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ScopeType.Property
member.summary: Property scope - after the property name and colon and throughout the value.
member.remarks: This scope is pushed when a property name and colon is found. The scope remains on the stack while the property value is parsed, but once the property value ends, it's immediately removed so that it doesn't appear on the stack after the value (ever).

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.Value
member.summary: The value of the last reported node.
member.remarks: This is non-null only if the last node was a PrimitiveValue or Property. If the last node is a PrimitiveValue this property returns the value: - null if the null token was found. - boolean if the true or false token was found. - string if a string token was found. - DateTime if a string token formatted as DateTime was found. - Int32 if a number which fits into the Int32 was found. - Double if a number which doesn't fit into Int32 was found. If the last node is a Property this property returns a string which is the name of the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.NodeType
member.summary: The type of the last node read.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.IsIeee754Compatible
member.summary: if it is IEEE754 compatible

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.Read
member.summary: Reads the next node from the input.
member.returns: true if a new node was found, or false if end of input was reached.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.IsWhitespaceCharacter(System.Char)
member.summary: Determines if a given character is a whitespace character.
member.param: The character to test.
member.returns: true if the is a whitespace; false otherwise.
member.remarks: Note that the behavior of this method is different from Char.IsWhitespace, since that method returns true for all characters defined as whitespace by the Unicode spec (which is a lot of characters), this one on the other hand recognizes just the whitespaces as defined by the JSON spec.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ParseValue
member.summary: Parses a "value", that is an array, object or primitive value.
member.returns: The node type to report to the user.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ParseProperty
member.summary: Parses a property name and the colon after it.
member.returns: The node type to report to the user.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ParseStringPrimitiveValue
member.summary: Parses a primitive string value.
member.returns: The value of the string primitive value.
member.remarks: Assumes that the current token position points to the opening quote. Note that the string parsing can never end with EndOfInput, since we're already seen the quote. So it can either return a string succesfully or fail.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ParseStringPrimitiveValue(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Parses a primitive string value.
member.param: Set to true if the first character in the string was a backslash. This is used when parsing DateTime values since they must start with an escaped slash character (\/).
member.returns: The value of the string primitive value.
member.remarks: Assumes that the current token position points to the opening quote. Note that the string parsing can never end with EndOfInput, since we're already seen the quote. So it can either return a string succesfully or fail.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ParseNullPrimitiveValue
member.summary: Parses the null primitive value.
member.returns: Always returns null if successful. Otherwise throws.
member.remarks: Assumes that the current token position points to the 'n' character.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ParseBooleanPrimitiveValue
member.summary: Parses the true or false primitive values.
member.returns: true of false boolean value if successful. Otherwise throws.
member.remarks: Assumes that the current token position points to the 't' or 'f' character.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ParseNumberPrimitiveValue
member.summary: Parses the number primitive values.
member.returns: Parse value to Int32, Decimal or Double. Otherwise throws.
member.remarks: Assumes that the current token position points to the first character of the number, so either digit, dot or dash.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ParseName
member.summary: Parses a name token.
member.returns: The value of the name token.
member.remarks: Name tokens are (for backward compat reasons) either - string value quoted with double quotes. - string value quoted with single quotes. - sequence of letters, digits, underscores and dollar signs (without quoted and in any order).

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.EndOfInput
member.summary: Called when end of input is reached.
member.returns: Always returns false, used for easy readability of the callers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.PushScope(Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ScopeType)
member.summary: Creates a new scope of type and pushes the stack.
member.param: The scope type to push.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.PopScope
member.summary: Pops a scope from the stack.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.TryPopPropertyScope
member.summary: Pops a property scope if it's present on the stack.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.SkipWhitespaces
member.summary: Skips all whitespace characters in the input.
member.returns: true if a non-whitespace character was found in which case the tokenStartIndex is pointing at that character. false if there are no non-whitespace characters left in the input.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.EnsureAvailableCharacters(System.Int32)
member.summary: Ensures that a specified number of characters after the token start is available in the buffer.
member.param: The number of character after the token to make available.
member.returns: true if at least the required number of characters is available; false if end of input was reached.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ConsumeTokenToString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Consumes the characters starting at the start of the token and returns them as a string.
member.param: The number of characters after the token start to consume.
member.returns: The string value of the consumed token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Json.JsonReader.ReadInput
member.summary: Reads more characters from the input.
member.returns: true if more characters are available; false if end of input was reached.
member.remarks: This may move characters in the characterBuffer, so after this is called all indeces to the characterBuffer are invalid except for tokenStartIndex.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.MediaTypeUtils

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.MediaTypeUtils.encodingUtf8NoPreamble
member.summary: UTF-8 encoding, without the BOM preamble.
member.remarks:
While a BOM preamble on UTF8 is generally benign, it seems that some MIME handlers under IE6 will not process the payload correctly when included.
Because the data service should include the encoding as part of the Content-Type in the response, there should be no ambiguity as to what encoding is being used.
For further information, see http://www.unicode.org/faq/utf_bom.html#BOM.

member.summary: A pointer into the linked list of attribute nodes which is only used if the currentBufferedNodeToReport is the attribute value node (not the attribute itself). In that case it points to the current attribute node. In all other cases this node is null.

member.summary: Moves the reader to the element which owns the current attribute.

member.summary: Moves the reader to the first attribute of the current element.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Metadata.BufferingXmlReader.MoveToNextAttribute
member.summary: Moves the reader to the next attribute on the current element.

member.summary: Reads the next node from the value of an attribute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Metadata.EdmLibraryExtensions.GetCollectionItemTypeName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns Collection item type name or null if the provided type name is not a collection.
member.param: Collection type name.
Whether it is a nested (recursive) call.
member.returns: Collection element type name or null if not a collection.
member.remarks: The following rules are used for collection type names: - it has to start with "Collection(" and end with ")" - trailing and leading whitespaces make the type not to be recognized as collection. - there is to be no characters (including whitespaces) between "Collection" and "(" - otherwise it won't berecognized as collection - collection item type name has to be a non-empty string - i.e. "Collection()" won't be recognized as collection - nested collection - e.g. "Collection(Collection(Edm.Int32))" - are not supported - we will throw Note the following are examples of valid type names which are not collection: - "Collection()" - " Collection(Edm.Int32)" - "Collection (Edm.Int32)" - "Collection("

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Metadata.XmlReaderExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for the XML reader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Metadata.XmlReaderExtensions.ReadElementValue(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Reads the value of the element as a string.
member.param: The reader to read from.
member.returns: The string value of the element.
member.remarks:
Pre-Condition: XmlNodeType.Element - the element to read the value for. XmlNodeType.Attribute - an attribute on the element to read the value for. Post-Condition: Any - the node after the element.
This method is similar to ReadElementContentAsString with one difference: - It ignores Whitespace nodes - this is needed for compatiblity, WCF DS ignores insignificant whitespaces it does that by setting the IgnoreWhitespace option on reader settings, ODataLib can't do that cause it doesn't always control the creation of the XmlReader, so it has to explicitely ignore insignificant whitespaces.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Metadata.XmlReaderExtensions.ReadElementContentValue(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Reads the value of the element as a string.
member.param: The reader to read from.
member.returns: The string value of the element.
member.remarks:
Pre-Condition: XmlNodeType.Element - the element to read the value for. XmlNodeType.Attribute - an attribute on the element to read the value for. Post-Condition: XmlNodeType.Element - the element was empty. XmlNodeType.EndElement - the element had some value.
This method is similar to ReadElementContentAsString with two differences: - It ignores Whitespace nodes - this is needed for compatiblity, WCF DS ignores insignificant whitespaces it does that by setting the IgnoreWhitespace option on reader settings, ODataLib can't do that cause it doesn't always control the creation of the XmlReader, so it has to explicitely ignore insignificant whitespaces. - It leaves the reader positioned on the EndElement node (or the start node if it was empty).

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Metadata.XmlReaderExtensions.NamespaceEquals(System.Xml.XmlReader,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the current node's namespace equals to the specified
member.param: The XML reader to get the current node from.
The namespace URI to compare, this must be a string already atomized in the name table.
member.returns: true if the current node is in the specified namespace; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Metadata.XmlReaderExtensions.LocalNameEquals(System.Xml.XmlReader,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the current node's local name equals to the specified
member.param: The XML reader to get the current node from.
The local name to compare, this must be a string already atomized in the name table.
member.returns: true if the current node has the specified local name; false otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.BatchPayloadUriOption
member.summary: Indicates the format of Request-URI in each sub request in the batch operation.

members.member:
Absolute URI with schema, host, port, and absolute resource path.
Example: GET https://host:1234/path/service/People(1) HTTP/1.1

Absolute resource path and separate Host header.
Example: GET /path/service/People(1) HTTP/1.1 Host: myserver.mydomain.org:1234

Resource path relative to the batch request URI.
Example: GET People(1) HTTP/1.1

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataBatchReaderState.ChangesetEnd

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataBatchReaderState.Completed
member.summary: The batch reader completed reading the batch payload.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataBatchReaderState.Exception
member.summary: The batch reader encountered an error reading the batch payload.
member.remarks: The batch reader cannot be used in this state anymore.

member.summary: Scans the current buffer for the specified boundary.

Stop if no boundary (or boundary start) is found after this number of bytes.

Stop if no boundary start was found after this number of non end-of-line bytes.
The start position of the line end or -1 if not found.
The start position of the boundary delimiter or -1 if not found.
member.returns: An enumeration value indicating whether the boundary start was completely, partially or not found in the buffer.

The start position of the line terminator or -1 if not found.
The end position of the line terminator or -1 if not found.
true if the end of the buffer was reached while scanning for the line end; otherwise false.
member.returns: An enumeration value indicating whether the line termintor was found completely, partially or not at all.

member.remarks: This listener can choose to fail, if the currently written payload doesn't support in-stream error at this position. If the listener returns, the writer should not allow any more writing, since the in-stream error is the last thing in the payload.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.ODataCollectionReaderState
member.summary: Enumeration of all possible states of an .

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataCollectionReaderState.Start
member.summary: The reader is at the start; nothing has been read yet.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataCollectionReaderState.CollectionStart
member.summary: The reader has started reading and is reading the start element of the collection wrapper (if any). No items have been read.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns an instance of .

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataCollectionReaderState.Value
member.summary: The reader read an item from the collection.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns the read item (a primitive value or null).

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataCollectionReaderState.CollectionEnd
member.summary: The reader has finished reading and is reading the end element of the collection wrapper (if any). All items have been read.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns the same instance of as in state CollectionStart.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataCollectionReaderState.Exception
member.summary: The reader has thrown an exception; nothing can be read from the reader anymore.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataCollectionReaderState.Completed
member.summary: The reader has completed; nothing can be read anymore.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.ODataCollectionWriterCore.Microsoft#OData#IODataOutputInStreamErrorListener#OnInStreamError
member.summary: This method notifies the listener, that an in-stream error is to be written.
member.remarks: This listener can choose to fail, if the currently written payload doesn't support in-stream error at this position. If the listener returns, the writer should not allow any more writing, since the in-stream error is the last thing in the payload.

member.summary: Gets the current state of the reader.
member.returns: The current state of the reader.

member.summary: Gets the current sub state of the reader.
member.returns: The current sub state of the reader.
member.remarks: The sub state is a complement to the current state if the current state itself is not enough to determine the real state of the reader. The sub state is only meaningful in ExpandedNavigationProperty state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReader.Item
member.summary: Gets the most recent that has been read.
member.returns: The most recent that has been read.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReader.Read
member.summary: Reads the next from the message payload.
member.returns: true if more items were read; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReader.ReadAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously reads the next from the message payload.
member.returns: A task that when completed indicates whether more items were read.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReaderState
member.summary: Enumeration of all possible states of an .

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReaderState.Start
member.summary: The reader is at the start; nothing has been read yet.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReaderState.DeltaResourceSetStart
member.summary: The start of a delta resource set has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an but no properties may be filled in until the DeltaResourceSetEnd state is reached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReaderState.DeltaResourceSetEnd
member.summary: The end of a delta resource set has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an with all properties filled in.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReaderState.DeltaResourceStart
member.summary: The start of a delta resource has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an but no properties may be filled in until the EntryEnd state is reached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReaderState.DeltaResourceEnd
member.summary: The end of a delta resource has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an with all properties filled in.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReaderState.DeltaDeletedEntry
member.summary: An delta deleted resource was read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an which is fully populated. Note that there's no End state for this item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReaderState.DeltaLink
member.summary: An delta link was read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an which is fully populated. Note that there's no End state for this item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReaderState.DeltaDeletedLink
member.summary: An delta deleted link was read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an which is fully populated. Note that there's no End state for this item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReaderState.Exception
member.summary: The reader has thrown an exception; nothing can be read from the reader anymore.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReaderState.Completed
member.summary: The reader has completed; nothing can be read anymore.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataDeltaReaderState.NestedResource
member.summary: A nested resource info was read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns the current item of the underlying nested resource reader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReader.DetectPayloadKind
member.summary: Determines the potential payload kinds and formats of the payload being read and returns it.
member.returns: The set of potential payload kinds and formats for the payload being read by this reader.
member.remarks: When this method is called it first analyzes the content type and determines whether there are multiple matching payload kinds registered for the message's content type. If there are, it then runs the payload kind detection on all formats that have a matching payload kind registered. Note that this method can return multiple results if a payload is valid for multiple payload kinds but will always at most return a single result per payload kind.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReader.DetectPayloadKindAsync
member.summary: Determines the potential payload kinds and formats of the payload being read and returns it.
member.returns: The set of potential payload kinds and formats for the payload being read by this reader.
member.remarks: When this method is called it first analyzes the content type and determines whether there are multiple matching payload kinds registered for the message's content type. If there are, it then runs the payload kind detection on all formats that have a matching payload kind registered. Note that this method can return multiple results if a payload is valid for multiple payload kinds but will always at most return a single result per payload kind.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.validations
member.summary: Validation settings.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.Validations
member.summary: Gets or sets validation settings.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.BaseUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the document base URI (used as base for all relative URIs). If this is set, it must be an absolute URI. ODataMessageReaderSettings.BaseUri may be deprecated in the future, please use ODataMessageReaderSettings.baseUri instead.
member.returns: The base URI used in payload.
member.remarks: This URI will be used in ATOM format only, it would be overridden by <xml:base /> element in ATOM payload. If the URI does not end with a slash, a slash would be appended automatically.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.ClientCustomTypeResolver
member.summary: Gets or sets custom type resolver used by the Client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.PrimitiveTypeResolver
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom resolver for resolving untyped primitive values

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.EnablePrimitiveTypeConversion
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to convert all primitive values to the type specified in the model or provided as an expected type. Note that values will still be converted to the type specified in the payload itself.
member.returns: false if primitive values and report values are not converted; true if all primitive values are converted to the type specified in the model or provided as an expected type. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.EnableMessageStreamDisposal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the message stream will be disposed after finishing writing with the message.
member.returns: true if the message stream will be disposed after finishing writing with the message; otherwise false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.EnableCharactersCheck
member.summary: Flag to control whether the reader should check for valid Xml characters or not.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.MaxProtocolVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum OData protocol version the reader should accept and understand.
member.returns: The maximum OData protocol version the reader should accept and understand.
member.remarks: If the payload to be read has higher OData-Version than the value specified for this property the reader will fail. Reader will also not report features which require higher version than specified for this property. It may either ignore such features in the payload or fail on them.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.MessageQuotas
member.summary: Quotas to use for limiting resource consumption when reading an OData message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.ReadUntypedAsString
member.summary: Whether to read untyped values as a raw string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.ShouldIncludeAnnotation
member.summary: Func to evaluate whether an annotation should be read or skipped by the reader. The func should return true if the annotation should be read and false if the annotation should be skipped. A null value indicates that all annotations should be skipped.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.Validator
member.summary: Gets the bound validator.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.ThrowOnDuplicatePropertyNames
member.summary: Returns whether ThrowOnDuplicatePropertyNames validation setting is enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.ThrowIfTypeConflictsWithMetadata
member.summary: Returns whether ThrowIfTypeConflictsWithMetadata is enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.ODataMessageReaderSettings.ThrowOnUndeclaredPropertyForNonOpenType
member.summary: Returns whether ThrowOnUndeclaredPropertyForNonOpenType validation setting is enabled.
